III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 2/24/24 Supervisor 1 allegedly grabbed Youth A and hit him in
the stomach.
Investigation I spoke individually to Administrator 1, Complainant 1, and
FCW 1 on 2/27/24 via telephone. Allegations were discussed. No
new information was provided.
On 2/28/24, I completed the below interviews with DHHS Worker
1 at the facility.
Youth A:
Youth A initially reported he was not punched in the stomach by
any staff or youth, but then changed his mind and reported he was
punched in the stomach by Supervisor 1. Youth A reported he was
punched after dinner and this occurred inside the unit building.
Youth A was not able to provide any other details on time or
location. Youth A reported he cursed at staff and called Staff 1
names. Youth A reported then Supervisor 1 punched him. Youth A
no longer wanted to be interviewed and asked to leave the room.
Supervisor 1:
Supervisor 1 reported he was in the unit office when Youth A
asked him if he could use the phone to call his grandmother.
Supervisor 1 reported they called, but she did not pick up the
phone. After this, Youth A became upset, cussed at everyone and
left the unit. Supervisor 1 reported he walked with him outside
and then they came back into the building. No one else was
around at this time. Youth A began kicking the doors inside and
grabbed a folder off the wall and threw the papers in the folder on
the floor. Supervisor 1 reported he was redirecting Youth A’s
behavior, but Youth A would not listen. Supervisor 1 reported he
2

bent down to grab the papers thrown on the floor and extended
his hand so that Youth A would not come close to him while he
was picking items up from the floor. Youth A did come close and
Supervisor 1 reported his hand touched Youth A’s stomach. Youth
A fell to the floor and said, “You punched me!” Youth A then left
the unit and Supervisor 1 followed him. Youth A was eventually
deescalated later in the evening.
Video Observation:
I reviewed video on 2/24/24 at 3:45pm. Supervisor 1 and Youth A
were the only ones in the unit hallway. Youth A is walking around
the unit and grabbed a folder off the wall, causing paper from the
folder to fall on the floor. Youth A was within a couple feet of
Supervisor 1. Supervisor 1 bent down to pick up the paperwork
and extended his arm out. Supervisor 1’s hand does touch Youth
A's stomach, but not with a force. Youth A fell to the ground
holding his stomach and when Supervisor 1 did not react to his
behavior, Youth A stood up and pushed Supervisor 1. Supervisor
1 did not react to Youth A’s assault.
Documents:
• I reviewed a written statement completed by Supervisor 1
on 2/24/24 to Administrator 2 outlining the issues that
Youth A had on 2/24/24 throughout the afternoon shift.
Supervisor 1’s documentation aligns with his interview
account.
• I reviewed Supervisor 1’s personnel file. All training and
clearances are up to date. Supervisor 1 does not have
disciplinary action in his file.
Analysis Based on Supervisor 1’s interview and the review of the video
footage, it is clear that Supervisor 1 did not punch Youth A in the
stomach.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
